items.sentence: I'll never find a keyboard patch that actually sounds like an electric guitar.
I wanted to be a singer, but I was told that I should learn to play the drums.
It may never be known how we silly Anglophones got "baloney" out of "bologna."
Tom got out in front of the library and waited while Mary went to park the car.
Tom discovered that life on the road wasn\'t as easy as he thought it would be.
Tom isn\'t alone in thinking that Mary is the most beautiful girl in his class.
I imagine that Tom will eventually learn to deal with the way people treat him.
I can\'t figure out how to transfer MP3 files from my iPod back to my computer.
I wonder whether or not Tom has already told Mary she doesn\'t have to do that.
I wonder whether or not Tom has already told Mary she doesn\'t need to do that.
If Tom had been wearing his seat belt, he wouldn\'t have been injured so badly.
I\'d like to go through just one day without being told I look like my brother.
It\'s been raining heavily since this morning, so I don\'t want to go anywhere.
I like pigs. Dogs look up to us. Cats look down on us. Pigs treat us as equals.
I don\'t think I\'ll ever sound like a native speaker no matter how much I try.
If it looks like an apple and it tastes like an apple, it\'s probably an apple.
Tom wasn\'t looking at Mary, but he was listening to everything she was saying.
Tom and I could\'ve saved ourselves a lot of time by just doing that ourselves.
Tom assumed Mary was talking nonsense simply because he didn\'t understand her.
Tom apparently hasn\'t yet told Mary that he\'s planning to drop out of school.
